item.title: 尽管气候问题引发反弹，绿色债券销售仍创下历史新高
item.description: 尽管美国和欧洲在政策和监管方面有所退步，但随着人工智能推动能源基础设施需求的蓬勃发展，投资者今年纷纷涌入气候友好型资产。【原文：Investors have piled into climate-friendly assets this year despite policy and regulatory rollbacks in the US and Europe, as artificial intelligence drives a boom in energy infrastructure demand.】

item.title: 日本央行观望，东京通胀降温超预期
item.description: 由于食品和能源价格压力减弱，东京的通胀降温幅度超过预期，但这不太可能阻止日本央行进一步加息。【原文：Tokyo’s inflation cooled more than expected, as pressures from food and energy prices faded, but is unlikely to deter the Bank of Japan from further rate hikes.】

item.title: 白银升至创纪录水平，黄金接近历史新高，风险持续存在
item.description: 由于地缘政治局势持续紧张，白银价格创下历史新高，黄金价格也接近历史高点。【原文：Silver rose to a record and gold traded near an all-time high, as geopolitical tensions persisted.】

item.title: 受委内瑞拉封锁和尼日利亚罢工影响，石油有望实现周线上涨
item.description: 石油创下 10 月下旬以来的最大单周涨幅，原因是交易商追踪到美国对委内瑞拉原油运输的部分封锁，以及华盛顿对尼日利亚一个恐怖组织的军事打击。【原文：Oil headed for the biggest weekly gain since late October, as traders tracked a partial US blockade of crude shipments from Venezuela and a military strike by Washington against a terrorist group in Nigeria.】

item.title: 日本小型 IPO 在市场改革中跌至 12 年新低
item.description: 由于东京证券交易所推进改革，促使私营公司重新考虑快速上市，今年日本小型首次公开募股的数量降至十多年来的最低点。【原文：The number of small-sized initial public offerings in Japan this year fell to its lowest in more than a decade, as the Tokyo Stock Exchange’s reform push prompted private companies to reconsider quick listings.】

item.title: 非洲进出口银行与加纳解决 7.5 亿美元贷款纠纷
item.description: 非洲进出口银行与加纳就一笔 7.5 亿美元贷款的纠纷达成和解，但未透露是否会承担损失。【原文：The African Export-Import Bank has settled a dispute with Ghana over a $750 million loan, though it didn’t disclose if it would take losses.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将在假日交易中低调开盘：市场综述
item.description: 由于多个地区市场仍在假期休市，亚洲股市开盘后将表现平淡。周三美股延续了今年以来的涨势，市场情绪可能总体保持积极。【原文：Asian stocks are set for a muted open with several regional markets still shut for holidays. Sentiment may remain generally positive after US shares extended this year’s gain on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本央行政策谨慎，2026 年日元看跌呼声渐起
item.description: 在日本央行最近一次加息未能持续提振日元之后，看跌日元的呼声日益高涨，这也强化了一种观点，即日元的结构性疲软没有快速解决办法。【原文：The bearish chorus on the yen is growing louder after the Bank of Japan’s latest interest rate hike failed to deliver a sustained lift to the currency, reinforcing views that there’s no quick fix for its structural weakness.】

item.title: 高市、人工智能、企业改革为 2026 年的日本股票铺平道路
item.description: 随着日本首相高市真奈的积极财政计划在过去一年的基础上再接再厉，日本股市有望在 2026 年延续涨势。【原文：Japan’s stocks are expected to extend gains in 2026, with Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s aggressive fiscal plans building on the momentum of the past year.】

item.title: 埃及在通胀放缓后第五次降息
item.description: 埃及中央银行今年第五次降息，此前通胀率意外放缓，为当局恢复宽松周期提供了空间。【原文：Egypt’s central bank made its fifth interest-rate cut of the year, after a surprise slowdown in inflation gave authorities scope to resume an easing cycle.】

item.title: 诺瓦克称制裁推迟了俄罗斯将液化天然气产量提高两倍的计划
item.description: 俄罗斯副总理亚历山大-诺瓦克（Alexander Novak）表示，在国际制裁的影响下，俄罗斯将液化天然气年产量提高三倍的雄心已被推迟数年。【原文：Russia’s ambitions to triple its annual liquefied gas production have been pushed back by several years amid international sanctions, according to Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak.】

item.title: 奇货可居：斯科特-库珀（Scott Kupor）谈为政府引进人才（播客
item.description: 奇货可居：斯科特-库珀（Scott Kupor）谈为政府引进人才（播客【原文：Odd Lots: Scott Kupor on Bringing Talent to Government (Podcast)】

item.title: 日本高市称中国通信大门依然敞开
item.description: 日本首相高市真奈表示，与中国沟通的大门依然敞开，东京与北京建立建设性、稳定关系的目标在她上任的两个月中始终如一。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said the door to communications with China remains open and Tokyo’s goal of building a constructive, stable relationship with Beijing has been consistent through her two months in office.】

item.title: 中国白银基金连番出手平息狂热后暴跌
item.description: 周四，中国唯一的纯银基金价值暴跌了10%，跌幅达到每日最大限额，结束了疯狂的牛市行情，这也促使该基金经理罕见地发出了一系列警告。【原文：The value of China’s only pure-play silver fund plunged by its maximum daily limit of 10% on Thursday, ending a frenzied bull run that had prompted its manager to issue a rare series of warnings.】

item.title: 上田发出进一步加息信号，对价格目标更有信心
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）表示，由于对央行更接近实现可持续物价目标的信心不断增强，明年可能会进一步加息。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda signaled further interest hikes are likely coming next year, by projecting rising confidence that the central bank is closer to attaining its sustainable price target.】

item.title: 日本高市将公布创纪录的 1220 万亿日元 26 财政年度预算案
item.description: 日本首相佐那江-高市（Sanae Takaichi）领导的政府计划为 4 月开始的财政年度公布创纪录的初步预算，其支出增长速度将超过通货膨胀率。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s government plans to unveil a record initial budget for the fiscal year starting in April, increasing outlays at a faster pace than inflation.】

item.title: 泰国贸易赤字因进口激增和泰铢走强而扩大
item.description: 泰国连续第二个月出现高于预期的贸易赤字，原因是进口增长超过了疲软的出口增长，凸显了包括泰铢走强威胁竞争力在内的经济风险。【原文：Thailand posted a higher-than-expected trade deficit for a second month as a jump in imports outpaced sluggish export growth, underscoring economic risks including a stronger baht that threatens competitiveness.】

item.title: 日本两年期债券收益率在不温不火的拍卖需求后上升
item.description: 由于市场猜测日本央行可能需要更积极地提高利率以抑制通胀和支撑日元，日本两年期国债收益率在一次该期限国债拍卖吸引了疲软的需求后有所上升。【原文：Japan’s two-year government bond yield rose after an auction of the tenor drew weak demand amid speculation that the Bank of Japan may need to raise interest rates more aggressively to rein in inflation and support the yen.】

item.title: 风险持续存在，韩国央行保持 2026 年降息立场选择开放
item.description: 韩国央行表示，将为明年进一步降息敞开大门，同时对韩元疲软和房价上涨带来的金融稳定风险提高警惕。【原文：South Korea’s central bank said it will keep the door open to further interest rate cuts next year, while increasing vigilance over financial stability risks from a weak won and rising housing prices.】

item.title: 中国人民银行向多头让步，人民币升破 7 元兑 1 美元
item.description: 人民币汇率自 2024 年 9 月以来首次突破 1 美元兑 7 元的心理里程碑，原因是市场押注中国央行将允许人民币逐步升值，以提振市场信心。【原文：The yuan climbed past the psychological milestone of 7 per dollar for the first time since September 2024, on bets China’s central bank will allow gradual currency appreciation to boost market confidence.】

item.title: 中国万科在躲过违约后再次面临债券考验
item.description: 中国万科股份有限公司（China Vanke Co.）几天前刚刚获得了地方债券的缓期偿还，现在又回到了熟悉的境地，因为投资者在另一份说明中完成了对这家陷入困境的开发商推迟偿债的请求的投票。【原文：China Vanke Co., which just days ago got a reprieve on a local bond, is back in a familiar situation, as investors in another note finish voting on the distressed developer’s bid to delay payment amid its struggle with a mountain of debt due in coming months.】

item.title: 日本等待两年期债券拍卖，加息担忧与日俱增
item.description: 投资者在周四日本两年期国债拍卖前惶惶不可终日，他们猜测日本央行可能需要更积极地提高利率，以抑制通胀和支撑日元。【原文：Investors are on tenterhooks ahead of Japan’s two-year government bond auction on Thursday, amid speculation that the Bank of Japan may need to raise interest rates more aggressively to rein in inflation and support the yen.】

item.title: 英伟达与芯片初创公司 Groq 达成授权协议
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）与人工智能初创公司 Groq 达成了一项许可协议，进一步加大了对与人工智能热潮相关的公司的投资。【原文：Nvidia Corp. agreed to a licensing deal with artificial intelligence startup Groq, furthering its investments in companies connected to the AI boom.】

item.title: 前官员称日本央行在推动经济增长期间需谨慎对待利率问题
item.description: 一位前董事会成员表示，日本央行应采取谨慎的态度来提高利率，而政府则应全力以赴为经济注入活力。【原文：The Bank of Japan should take a cautious approach to raising interest rates while the government pulls out all the stops to energize the economy, according to a former board member.】

item.title: 400 Capital 因被控在 CMBS 贷款中采取攫取费用的策略而提起诉讼
item.description: 与曼哈顿中城房产相关的 1.3 亿美元贷款成为诉讼的焦点，该诉讼指控一家受雇确保偿还债务的公司采取了自私自利的策略。【原文：A $130 million loan tied to Midtown Manhattan properties is at the center of a lawsuit that accuses a firm hired to ensure the debt is repaid of self-serving tactics.】

item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. warned investors in some of its alternative investment funds that their data may have been exposed in a breach at one of the bank’s law firms.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔号快船将在圣诞节后为纽约带来小雪
item.description: 周五，一场被称为 "阿尔伯塔快船"（Alberta Clipper）的快速移动风暴将把冷空气推向美国东北部和大西洋中部各州，在纽约市降雪，然后在华盛顿特区转为降雨。【原文：A fast moving storm dubbed the Alberta Clipper will push freezing air into the US Northeast and mid-Atlantic states Friday, dropping snow on New York City before turning to rain in Washington, D.C.】

item.description: 美国抵押贷款利率连续第二周走低。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US ticked lower for a second straight week.】

item.title: 路易达孚称首席财务官帕特里克-特雷尔 "意外 "去世
item.description: 路易达孚公司（Louis Dreyfus Co.）首席财务官、农产品贸易巨头创始家族的亲密伙伴帕特里克-特雷尔（Patrick Treuer）"一夜之间 "意外去世，享年52岁。【原文：Louis Dreyfus Co. said Patrick Treuer, chief financial officer and a close associate of the agricultural trading giant’s founding family, died “unexpectedly overnight” at the age of 52.】
